column4: hi! trying to install ubuntu from CD and it fails installing the base-files package. can the CD be corrupt?
did you check the md5sums on the iso?
ok, next week then, when i have been home again to get another one
do a google, cause some cd drives can be weird i remember something about booting with nocddma or soethin
i think the wiki should have info on install cheat codes some where
Failed to read scan data : Operation not supported i guess thats not supported in the driver then?
i know some cards need to be UP before scanning. so try "ifconfig <iface> up" and then scan again
its up and connected at the moment
sorry, no idea and gotta go now calling it a day :-)
i just wanted to test the overlaps of some of my access points with something like xps show available networks thing
and thanks again for suggestions! will try them!
